meanings.sent1: I used a number to solve the math problem.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked us to write down a number on the board.
meanings.sent3: The number of apples in the basket was so large, it looked like a mountain of fruit!
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a bright number in a dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The number on the clock seemed to tick away the seconds like a tiny heartbeat.

meanings.sent1: There were a large number of people at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The number of books on the shelf was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The number of cookies in the jar kept mysteriously decreasing.
meanings.sent4: His kindness knew no bounds, like an infinite number of good deeds.
meanings.sent5: The number of stars in the sky at night was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To assign a number to something
meanings.sent1: I will number the pages of my report before submitting it.
meanings.sent2: She decided to number the boxes for easier identification.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to number the toys in order of preference.
meanings.sent4: His memories were carefully numbered in his mind like a library catalog.
meanings.sent5: She would number the days until her birthday with excitement.

meanings.definition: To total or add up to a certain amount
meanings.sent1: The coins will number to ten dollars in total.
meanings.sent2: The votes will number up to decide the winner.
meanings.sent3: The candies began to number in her hand as she kept counting.
meanings.sent4: His achievements would number like stars in the sky, each one shining brightly.
meanings.sent5: The drops of rain would number together to form a soothing melody on the roof.
